multiselectdropdown module

class multiselectdropdown.MultiSelectDropdown(master, options: list[str], selected_options: list[str], *args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Frame

A Tkinter Frame widget that provides a multi-select dropdown functionality.

This class simulates a dropdown using a Toplevel window and a Listbox, allowing users to select multiple options from a list. The selected options are displayed on the main frame.

Parameters:

  • master (tk.Widget) – The parent widget.

  • options (list[str]) – A list of available options to choose from.

  • selected_options (list[str]) – A list to store the options selected by the user.

  • args – Additional positional arguments for the parent tk.Frame.

  • kwargs – Additional keyword arguments for the parent tk.Frame.

confirm_selection() → None[source]

Confirms the user’s selection from the dropdown.

Retrieves the indices of the selected options from the Listbox, updates the selected_options list, and displays the selected options in the label on the main frame.

Returns:

None

show_dropdown()[source]

Displays a dropdown window with a list of options for the user to select.

This method creates a Toplevel window containing a Listbox with multiple selection mode enabled. It allows the user to select options from the list of available options.

Returns:

None
